itemBody.p: [1:B] Look at the content and the formatting of the text in this item. Each part of the text is labelled with a number, in sequence, followed by one of the letters 'B' or 'I' which stand for 'block' or 'inline' respectively. A system fails if (a) any of the numbered parts are missing; (b) any block parts run in with the previous text; (c) any inline parts do not run in with the previous text; (d) any of the parts labelled as being distinguishable appear the same when rendered.
[2:B] The following 6 headings should be distinguishable:

[9:B] This paragraph contains inline parts that do not need to be distinguishable from this run of plain text: [10:I] abbr (abbreviated form) [11:I] acronym (an acronym) [12:I] cite (a citation or a reference to other sources) [13:I] dfn (the defining instance of the enclosed term) [14:I] span (grouping element)

[15:B] This paragraph contains inline parts that should be distinguishable from plain text by the user: [16:I] code (a fragment of computer code) [17:I] kbd (text to be entered by the user) [18:I] samp (sample output from programs, scripts, etc.) [19:I] var (an instance of a variable or program argument)
[20:B] This paragraph contains inline parts that must be distinguishable by the user: [21:I] em (emphasis) [22:I] strong (strong emphasis)

blockquote.p: [23:B] blockquote (quoted text). There is no specific requirement for rendering of blockquote text, except to note the following remark from the HTML 4.01 specification.

[24:B] We recommend that style sheet implementations provide a mechanism for inserting quotation marks before and after a quotation delimited by BLOCKQUOTE in a manner appropriate to the current language context and the degree of nesting of quotations. However, as some authors have used BLOCKQUOTE merely as a mechanism to indent text, in order to preserve the intention of the authors, user agents should not insert quotation marks in the default style.

itemBody.p: [25:B] The handling of quoted text requires particular attention, as per the folling note, which itself should appear with delimiting quotation marks: [26:I] Visual user agents must ensure that the content of the Q element is rendered with delimiting quotation marks. Authors should not put quotation marks at the beginning and end of the content of a Q element.
itemBody.div: [27:B] div (generic language/style container): although marked as a block element div is normally used to contain other block elements.
itemBody.pre: [28:B] pre (preformatted text) The rendering should (where appropriate): (a) leave white space intact (b) render with a fixed-pitch font (c) disable automatic word wrapping
